description: The underlying cause of CVE-2023-6346 is a 'use after free' condition in the WebAudio component of the Chromium open source software, which is integrated into Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw occurs when the memory associated with an object is freed, but a pointer still references it, leading to potential exploitation if accessed. This particular vulnerability has been addressed in the stable release of Microsoft Edge version 119.0.2151.97, which was published on November 29, 2023, ensuring that the browser is no longer susceptible to this security issue. The installed KB Article is KB-119.0.2151.97, which provides details about this fix and related security updates. The previous version of affected builds included 119.0.6045.199 and 118.0.5993.159.
